sen.j: 五行歌（ごぎょうか）とは、『古事記』、『日本書紀』に遺されていた古代歌謡、和歌を日本の詩歌の原型として現代に生かした新詩型。
sen.e: Revived in modern times as prototypes of Japanese poetry, five line poems are a new type of poetry which utilizes ancient ballads and Waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) included in "Kojiki" (the Records of Ancient Matters" and "Nihon Shoki"(The Chronicle of Japan).

Revived in modern times as prototypes of Japanese poetry, five line poems are a new type of poetry which utilize ancient ballads and Waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) included in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan).

sen.e: Gogyoka (Five Line Poems, 五行歌) is a new type of poetry which utilizes ancient ballads and Waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) included in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihon Shoki" (The Chronicles of Japan) and is revived in modern times as prototypes of Japanese poetry.
sen.cmt: 「五行歌」が文頭に来るように一部文章を変更しました。

sen.j: 一行を一息で読める長さとしての一句として五行で書くという規定以外にいっさいの制約がないことを基本としている。
sen.e: There are basically no rules but one that a poem must be written with five lines, each of which can be pronounced within one exhalation.
Aside from the condition that it must be written with fives lines that can each be read aloud in one breath, there are basically no rules to a five line poem.

sen.j: 行分けによる呼吸論に着目して個々の独自性と理想型を目指した詩歌形式を創始者草壁焔太が発案し、定着させた。
sen.e: Enta KUSAKABE,who had been pursuing an original and ideal style of poetry, suggested and established this form after he appreciated its line by line breathing system.
Enta KUSAKABE, who had been pursuing an original and ideal style of poetry, suggested and established this form after finding appreciation for the line-by-line breathing system.

sen.j: 短歌や俳句のような呼吸が一定の音数律詩歌の音数規定を外し音数を自由にすることができる。
sen.e: Five line poems are free from the syllabic meter codes which are essential factors of the rhythm poetry such as Tanka (thirty-one-syllable poems) and Haiku (seventeen- syllable poems), therefore writers can have a choice of the number of syllables.

sen.j: それにより、詩歌の言葉運びやフレーズ運び、行運びによる各自の呼吸運びに創造性をもたせ、詩歌としての言葉を生き生きと甦らせている。
sen.e: Because of this, writers can have a creative breathing style by arranging words, phrases, and lines as they please, and words in a verse are to be revived vividly.

sen.e: This allows writers to have creativity with each breath in their pace of words, phrases and lines, and they can lively recite the words as a poem.
